name: Yunlong's personal page
body:
### Welcome to my personal page.
I am currently a sixth year PhD student in the Computational Science & Engineering program, at Georgia Tech. My research interests include machine learning and numerical optimization.

Contact:
Address: 686 Cherry Street, Atlanta, GA, 30332-0160
Office: 167 Skiles
Email: heyunlong (AT) gatech.edu

#### About Me:
I work with Prof. Haesun Park matrix factorization methods for data mining. I am also working on nonlinear optimization problems with Prof. Renato Monteiro. Before I came to Georgia Tech in the fall of 2009, I received my B.S. in Mathematics from University of Science and Technology of China (USTC). I got my M.S. degree in Statistics in 2013

#### Manuscripts:
- Y. He, R. D. C. Monteiro, Accelerating block-decomposition first-order methods for solving generalized saddle-point and Nash equilibrium problems. Oct. 2013. Submitted to SIAM Journal on Optimization
- Y. He, R. D. C. Monteiro, An accelerated HPE-type algorithm for a class of composite convex-concave saddle-point problems. Apr. 2014. Submitted to SIAM Journal on Optimization

#### Refereed Journal and Conference Articles:
- Y. He, K.Kavukcuoglu, Y. Wang, A. Szlam and Y. Qi, Unsupervised Feature Learning by Deep Sparse Coding, Proceedings of the SIAM International Conference on Data Mining, 2014.
- J. Kim, Y. He and H. Park, Algorithms for Nonnegative Matrix and Tensor Factorizations: A Unified View Based on Block Coordinate Descent Framework. Journal of Global Optimization, March 2013.
- Y. He, Y. Qi, K.Kavukcuoglu and H. Park, Learning the Dependency Structure of Latent Factors, Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems 25, 2375--2383, 2012.
- Y. He, R. D. C. Monteiro, and H. Park, A Fast Algorithm for Sparse PCA and a New Sparsity Control Criterion, Proceedings of the SIAM International Conference on Data Mining, Mesa, AZ, April 28-30, 2011.
